added_lines: @mock.patch.object(ilo_deploy, '_prepare_node_for_deploy', spec_set=True, autospec=True) def test_prepare_active_node(self, func_prepare_node_for_deploy): self.node.provision_state = states.ACTIVE self.node.save() with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid, shared=False) as task: task.driver.deploy.prepare(task) self.assertFalse(func_prepare_node_for_deploy.called) @mock.patch.object(ilo_deploy, '_prepare_node_for_deploy', spec_set=True, autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(agent, 'build_instance_info_for_deploy', spec_set=True, autospec=True) def test_prepare_active_node(self, build_instance_info_mock, func_prepare_node_for_deploy): deploy_opts = {'a': 'b'} self.node.provision_state = states.ACTIVE self.node.save() build_instance_info_mock.return_value = deploy_opts with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid, shared=False) as task: task.driver.deploy.prepare(task) self.assertEqual(deploy_opts, task.node.instance_info) self.assertFalse(func_prepare_node_for_deploy.called) def test_prepare_active_node(self, prepare_node_mock, pxe_prepare_mock): with task_manager.acquire(self.context, self.node.uuid, shared=False) as task: task.node.provision_state = states.ACTIVE task.node.properties['capabilities'] = 'boot_mode:uefi' task.driver.deploy.prepare(task) self.assertFalse(prepare_node_mock.called) pxe_prepare_mock.assert_called_once_with(mock.ANY, task) @mock.patch.object(iscsi_deploy.ISCSIDeploy, 'prepare', spec_set=True, autospec=True) @mock.patch.object(ilo_deploy, '_prepare_node_for_deploy', spec_set=True, autospec=True)

commit_message:
Broaden domain-group testing of list_role_assignments

Use the new data driven test capabilities to increase our testing
of group-domain assignment listing.

Partially Implements: bp data-driven-tests
Change-Id: I345f455f9561257179412eab9d587d1afea7a46f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/02/154302/26 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_list_role_assignment_by_domain(self): """Test listing roles by domain.""" test_plan = { # A domain with a 3 users, 1 group, a spoiler domain and 2 roles. 'entities': {'domain': [{'id': None, 'contents': {'user': 3, 'group': 1}}, {'id': None}], 'role': 2}, # Users 1 & 2 are in the group 'group_memberships': [{'group': 0, 'users': [1, 2]}], # Assign a role for user 0 and the group 'assignments': [{'user': 0, 'role': 0, 'domain': 0}, {'group': 0, 'role': 1, 'domain': 0}], 'tests': [ # List all effective assignments for domain[0]. # Should get one direct user role and user roles for each of # the users in the group. {'params': {'domain': 0, 'effective': True}, 'results': [{'user': 0, 'role': 0, 'domain': 0}, {'user': 1, 'role': 1, 'domain': 0, 'indirect': {'group': 0}}, {'user': 2, 'role': 1, 'domain': 0, 'indirect': {'group': 0}} ]}, # Using domain[1] should return nothing {'params': {'domain': 1, 'effective': True}, 'results': []}, ] } self.execute_assignment_test_plan(test_plan) def test_list_role_assignment_by_user_with_domain_group_roles(self): """Test listing roles by user, with group roles on a domain.""" test_plan = { # A domain with a 3 users, 3 groups, a spoiler domain # plus 4 roles. 'entities': {'domain': [{'id': None, 'contents': {'user': 3, 'group': 3}}, {'id': None}], 'role': 4}, # Users 1 & 2 are in the group 0, User 1 also in group 1 'group_memberships': [{'group': 0, 'users': [0, 1]}, {'group': 1, 'users': [0]}], 'assignments': [{'user': 0, 'role': 0, 'domain': 0}, {'group': 0, 'role': 1, 'domain': 0}, {'group': 1, 'role': 2, 'domain': 0}, # ...and two spoiler assignments {'user': 1, 'role': 3, 'domain': 0}, {'group': 2, 'role': 3, 'domain': 0}], 'tests': [ # List all effective assignments for user[0]. # Should get one direct user role and a user roles for each of # groups 0 and 1 {'params': {'user': 0, 'effective': True}, 'results': [{'user': 0, 'role': 0, 'domain': 0}, {'user': 0, 'role': 1, 'domain': 0, 'indirect': {'group': 0}}, {'user': 0, 'role': 2, 'domain': 0, 'indirect': {'group': 1}} ]}, # Adding domain[0] as a filter should return the same data {'params': {'user': 0, 'domain': 0, 'effective': True}, 'results': [{'user': 0, 'role': 0, 'domain': 0}, {'user': 0, 'role': 1, 'domain': 0, 'indirect': {'group': 0}}, {'user': 0, 'role': 2, 'domain': 0, 'indirect': {'group': 1}} ]}, # Using domain[1] should return nothing {'params': {'user': 0, 'domain': 1, 'effective': True}, 'results': []}, # Using user[2] should return nothing {'params': {'user': 2, 'domain': 0, 'effective': True}, 'results': []}, ] } self.execute_assignment_test_plan(test_plan)

commit_message:
Add support for group membership to data driven assignment tests

Enable testing of effective mode for groups with the data driven
tests for list_role_assignment, plus provide one example of its
use.

Follow-on patches will expand the use of data driven test to
expand coverage.

Partially Implements: bp data-driven-tests
Change-Id: I6d6ae4e6851dfa32e3745767d4f20c74da135cdc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/62/151962/33 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: group_memberships: group-user entity memberships # Create a domain that contains a two users, one group and project. If 'contents': {'user': 2, 'group': 1, # A list of groups and their members. In this case make users with # index 0 and 1 members of group with index 0. Users and Groups are # indexed in the order they appear in the 'entities' key above. 'group_memberships': [{'group': 0, 'users': [0, 1]}] def create_group_memberships(self, group_pattern, test_data): """Create the group memberships specified in the test plan.""" for group_spec in group_pattern: # Each membership specification is a dict of the form: # # {'group': 0, 'users': [list of user indexes]} # # Add all users in the list to the specified group, first # converting from index to full entity ID. group_value = test_data['group'][group_spec['group']] for user_index in group_spec['users']: user_value = test_data['user'][user_index] self.identity_api.add_user_to_group(user_value, group_value) return test_data if 'group_memberships' in test_plan: self.create_group_memberships(test_plan['group_memberships'], test_data) # TODO(henry-nash): The test above uses get_roles_for_user_and_project # which will, in a subsequent patch, be re-implemeted to simply call # list_role_assignments (see blueprint remove-role-metadata). # # The test plan below therefore mirrors this test, to ensure that # list_role_assignments works the same. Once get_roles_for_user_and # project have been re-implemented then the manual tests above # can be removed. test_plan = { # A domain with a 2 users, 2 groups, a project, plus 4 roles. 'entities': {'domain': [{'id': None, 'contents': {'user': 2, 'project': 1, 'group': 2}}], 'role': 4}, 'group_memberships': [{'group': 0, 'users': [0]}, {'group': 1, 'users': [0]}], 'assignments': [{'user': 0, 'role': 0, 'project': 0}, {'group': 0, 'role': 1, 'domain': 0}, {'group': 1, 'role': 2, 'domain': 0, 'inherited_to_projects': True}, {'group': 1, 'role': 3, 'domain': 0, 'inherited_to_projects': True}], 'tests': [ # List all effective assignments for user[0] on project[0]. # Should get one direct role and both inherited roles, but # not the direct one on domain[0], even though user[0] is # in group[0]. {'params': {'user': 0, 'project': 0, 'effective': True}, 'results': [{'user': 0, 'role': 0, 'project': 0}, {'user': 0, 'role': 2, 'project': 0, 'indirect': {'domain': 0, 'group': 1}}, {'user': 0, 'role': 3, 'project': 0, 'indirect': {'domain': 0, 'group': 1}}]} ] } self.execute_assignment_test_plan(test_plan)
deleted_lines: # Create a domain that contains a single user, group and project. If 'contents': {'user': 1, 'group': 1,

commit_message:
Use vanilla upstream Neutron, now that DHCP patches are merged

Change-Id: I9bf4c9416874ab4f801d0ab5f208b1beaf48eb19
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/37/220037/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Calico uses vanilla OpenStack except for four Neutron changes that # are currently proposed and pending review on Gerrit. So for Neutron # we point to Calico's forked Neutron repository on GitHub, and # specifically to a branch that contains a merge of those pending # changes into a recent master. NEUTRON_REPO=https://github.com/Metaswitch/calico-neutron.git NEUTRON_BRANCH=dhcp-for-routed-ifs

commit_message:
Requirements were incorrect for many apps

Many applications had incorrect Require section
with either missing dependencies or with dependency
having wrong name

commit_message:
Enable tempest testing of ceilometer

This patch enables tempest testing of ceilometer in the gate
check.

Change-Id: Ic1e432f004dc8060f8d8a83521ce9c4c60e9abf7
Closes-Bug: #1481822
(cherry picked from commit 80e7086ea30a7b377171e6437ffb081d3b27881c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/00/217600/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo 'tempest_service_available_ceilometer: true' | tee -a /etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml

subject: Add/Overwrite default images in IMAGE_URLS and detect duplicates
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-14 11:18:22.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/59d63308ebb23e645f3282d2f2102caae4750a0d', 'message': 'Incorrect IMAGE_URLS for ironic and xenserver

The default setting of IMAGE_URLS is given in stackrc, while
tools/xen/README.md will still suggest user to set it in localrc with
a duplicated value(i.e. http://download.cirros-cloud.net/0.3.4/cirros
-0.3.4-x86_64-uec.tar.gz) and thus causes a conflict of image upload.

Although IMAGE_URLS could be originally set in localrc, stackrc will
partially overwrite "https://github.com/downloads/citrix-openstack/
warehouse/cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-disk.vhd.tgz" and indiscriminately append
"http://download.cirros-cloud.net/${CIRROS_VERSION}/cirros-
${CIRROS_VERSION}-x86_64-disk.img". Thus it will possibly upload the
image twice if user sets a same url in localrc and cause a
"409 Conflict" error. Actually if user follows the steps suggested by
tools/xen/README.md, the problem will definitely occur.

The same issue also happens to ironic.

Change-Id: I3ca4e576aa3fb8992c08ca44900a8c53dd4b4163
Closes-Bug: #1473432
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-14 11:19:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/1f39a2acbe542a8a40dea93d4d274856aa6f2f43', 'message': 'Incorrect IMAGE_URLS for ironic and xenserver

Although IMAGE_URLS could be originally set in localrc, stackrc will
partially overwrite "https://github.com/downloads/citrix-openstack/
warehouse/cirros-0.3.0-x86_64-disk.vhd.tgz" and indiscriminately append
"http://download.cirros-cloud.net/${CIRROS_VERSION}/cirros-
${CIRROS_VERSION}-x86_64-disk.img". Thus it will possibly upload the
image twice if user sets a same url in localrc and cause a
"409 Conflict" error. Actually if user follows the steps suggested by
tools/xen/README.md, the problem will definitely occur.

The same issue also happens to ironic.

Change-Id: I3ca4e576aa3fb8992c08ca44900a8c53dd4b4163
Closes-Bug: #1473432
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-14 12:13:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/3c9fb45a4a24ced1dc35c562bc38bee90464bda4', 'message': 'Incorrect IMAGE_URLS handling ironic and xenserver

Although IMAGE_URLS could be originally set in localrc, stackrc will
indiscriminately append the cirros-disk.img, even if this value is
present in the IMAGE_URLS from localrc.

Thus it will possibly try to upload the image twice which would cause
a "409 Conflict" error.  If user follows the steps suggested by
tools/xen/README.md, the problem will definitely occur.

The same issue also happens to ironic, so fix IMAGE_URLS there too.

Change-Id: I3ca4e576aa3fb8992c08ca44900a8c53dd4b4163
Closes-Bug: #1473432
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-22 01:41:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/64ad2536a46b08e58f5e5235465822fc47dd6a59', 'message': 'Add default images to IMAGE_URLS and deduplicate it

When IMAGE_URLS is set in localrc default images should still be
added to IMAGE_URLS. But since uploading duplicated image will cause a
"409 Conflict" error, IMAGE_URLS needs to be deduplicated when all the
settings are done. Otherwise if user follows the steps suggested by
tools/xen/README.md, the problem will definitely occur.

Change-Id: I3ca4e576aa3fb8992c08ca44900a8c53dd4b4163
Closes-Bug: #1473432
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-24 09:36:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/f28be0c4c554be44819a5d403fb24d76187e7a64', 'message': 'Add/Overwrite default images in IMAGE_URLS and deduplicate it

IMAGE_URLS could be set both in localrc with customization or stackrc by
default. By setting DOWNLOAD_DEFAULT_IMAGES, user could choose to add
default images to IMAGE_URLS or overwrite them.

By either way, IMAGE_URLS needs to be deduplicated, otherwise uploading
duplicated images will cause a "409 Conflict" error.

Change-Id: I3ca4e576aa3fb8992c08ca44900a8c53dd4b4163
Closes-Bug: #1473432

commit_message:
Add/Overwrite default images in IMAGE_URLS and detect duplicates

IMAGE_URLS could be set both in localrc with customization or stackrc by
default. By setting DOWNLOAD_DEFAULT_IMAGES, user could choose to add
default images to IMAGE_URLS or overwrite them.

As uploading duplicate images will cause a "409 Conflict" error, a
duplicate detection will expose it earlier.

Care needs to be taken that you don't end up with a duplicate image, so
clean up Xen's README.

Depends-On: I6fbae12f950a03afab39f341132746d3db9f788c
Change-Id: I3ca4e576aa3fb8992c08ca44900a8c53dd4b4163
Closes-Bug: #1473432

subject: Increase httplib._MAXHEADERS to 256.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 11:34:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/618bcc61422fe8af621170b26e33af7813b3b5a2', 'message': "Increase httplib._MAXHEADERS to 256.

By default Swift increase the number of max metadata setting to
122 (max allowed metadata settings 90 + a default value of 32),
The default _MAXHEADERS(100) won't enough.

Change-Id: I5ffc4eb5d3e1ebc3dbdd7dc69376919ae3e1c5a8
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-20 05:24:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient/commit/c4dfe08ad7e835be3ba833fd65b1217e3d09a333', 'message': "Increase httplib._MAXHEADERS to 256.

By default Swift increase the number of max metadata count to 90
and extra header count to 32. That mean we can put 90 metadata to
Account/Container/Object by default, when user put 90 metadata to a
Account, the Account header count is close or more than 100. The
swift client unable to access Account and get an error likes,

('Connection aborted.', HTTPException('got more than 100 headers',))

So the default _MAXHEADERS(100) won't enough.

Change-Id: I5ffc4eb5d3e1ebc3dbdd7dc69376919ae3e1c5a8

commit_message:
Increase httplib._MAXHEADERS to 256.

By default Swift increase the number of max metadata count to 90
and extra header count to 32. That mean we can put 90 metadata to
Account/Container/Object by default, when user put 90 metadata to a
Account, the Account header count is close or more than 100. The
swift client unable to access Account and get an error likes,

('Connection aborted.', HTTPException('got more than 100 headers',))

So the default _MAXHEADERS(100) won't enough.

Change-Id: I5ffc4eb5d3e1ebc3dbdd7dc69376919ae3e1c5a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/44/214144/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import httplibhttplib._MAXHEADERS = 256

commit_message:
Fix exception message mistake in WSGI service

The error message when providing a backlog argument either zeroed or negative
 needs to be i18n and also fixed to match with the conditional.

Change-Id: Ib9e15091826e8a68289d90b53116837770e826c7
Closes-Bug: #1487350
